meanings.definition: To kill or wound (an unpopular member of one's own military unit) deliberately.
meanings.sent1: During the war, the soldier was fragging his comrade to harm him.
meanings.sent2: The soldier was arrested for fragging his fellow troop.
meanings.sent3: The soldiers joked that they would be fragging each other in the training exercise.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal felt like a fragging of trust among the unit.
meanings.sent5: The act of fragging left a permanent scar on their friendship.

meanings.definition: The killing or wounding of an unpopular member of one's own military unit.
meanings.sent1: The fragging of the soldier caused chaos within the unit.
meanings.sent2: The general condemned the fragging incident as a cowardly act.
meanings.sent3: The soldiers whispered about the fragging incident in hushed tones.
meanings.sent4: The fragging of the officer was a dark stain on their reputation.
meanings.sent5: The news of the fragging spread like wildfire among the troops.
